com.samysadi.acs.service.checkpointing

Interface CheckpointingHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Probed
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CheckpointingHandlerDefault

    public interface CheckpointingHandler
extends Entity
    This interface defines methods to register virtual machines for automatic checkpointing and recovery.

    Note if you try to register for checkpointing a virtual machine that is already registered for checkpointing, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

    Since:
    1.0

      Returns the parent of this entity, or null if no parent is set

      Returns true if the given vm was already registered.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        CheckpointingHandler clone()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Notifier

        Returns the parent of this entity, or null if no parent is set
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the parent of this entity, or null

      • register

        boolean register(VirtualMachine vm)
        Selects and returns a host where to place the secondary vm.

        This method is the same as register(VirtualMachine, Host), and the destination host is selected using the parent CloudProvider's placement policy.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_REGISTERED notification is thrown.

        Parameters:
        vm -
        Returns:
        true if a host where to place the secondary VM was found
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given vm is already registered

      • register

        void register(VirtualMachine vm,
            Host destinationHost)
        Registers the given VM, and enables automatic checkpointing and recovery.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_REGISTERED notification is thrown.

        Parameters:
        vm -
        destinationHost - the host where to place the checkpoint of the vm
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given vm is already registered

      • unregister

        void unregister(VirtualMachine vm)
        Unregisters the given VM. No further automatic checkpointing or automatic recovery is possible.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_UNREGISTERED notification is thrown.

        Parameters:
        vm -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given vm was not registered

      • isRegistered

        boolean isRegistered(VirtualMachine vm)
        Returns true if the given vm was already registered.
        Parameters:
        vm -
        Returns:
        true if the given vm was already registered

      • getCheckpoint

        Checkpoint getCheckpoint(VirtualMachine vm)
        Returns the checkpoint that is associated with the given vm or null if the given vm is not registered for checkpointing.
        Parameters:
        vm -
        Returns:
        the checkpoint that is associated with the given vm or null
